content.question: A conducting object is initially uncharged and grounded, as shown in the figure. A particle with a charge <math alttext="positive Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mi>Q</mi></mpadded></math> is then brought close to the conducting object. What is the sign of the net charge, if any, on the conducting object while the charged particle is close to it?

choices.label: At first positive, but eventually zero
